geotorch
0.0.1

Introduction:

  • Introduction

Manifolds:

  • Real vector space: \(\mathbb{R}^n\)
  • Symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Sym}(n)\)
  • Skew-symmetric Matrices: \(\operatorname{Skew}(n)\)
  • Sphere: \(\mathbb{S}^n\)
  • Special Orthogonal Group: \(\operatorname{SO}(n)\)
  • Stiefel Manifold: \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\)
  • Grassmannian Manifold: \(\operatorname{Gr}(n,k)\)
  • Variety of Low Rank Matrices: \(\operatorname{LowRank}(n,k,r)\)
  • Constructions
geotorch
  • Docs »
  • Constructions

Constructions¶

These are the baseclasses that conform GeoTorch. In particular, every manifold is either a Manifold or a Fibration or an EmbeddedManifold. They can be used to easily implement new manifolds in terms of them and a function that parametrizes the wanted manifold.

class geotorch.manifold.Manifold(dimensions, size)[source]¶

Base class for a manifold. The class that implements the manifold should implement trivialization().

This class automatically implement the framework of dynamic trivializations describe in Trivializations for Gradient-Based Optimization on Manifolds - Lezcano-Casado, M. (2019) allowing to perform Riemannian gradient descent by calling after each SGD step to update_base().

For matrix manifolds, this class identifies \(\mathbb{R}^{k \times n}\) with \(\mathbb{R}^{n \times k}\) for \(k > n\) by transposing the matrix before and after applying the trivialization.

Parameters

  • dimensions (int) – Number of dimensions of the manifold as a tensor. For example, a matrix manifold would have 2 dimensions, while a vector would have 1. It should be a positive number

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

trivialization(X, B)[source]¶

Parametrizes the manifold in terms of a tangent space

Parameters

  • X (torch.Tensor) – A tensor from the tangent space \(T_B M\)

  • B (torch.Tensor) – A point on the manifold \(M\) at whose tangent space we are trivializing

Returns

A tensor on the manifold

Return type

tensor (torch.Tensor)

Note

This function should be surjective, otherwise not all the manifold will be explored

update_base(zero=True)[source]¶

Changes self.base to the current output of self.original. It allows for the implementation of dynamic trivializations and RGD. If zero == True it also zeros-out the original parametrized tensor

Parameters

zero (bool,Optional) – If True, this method will zero-out the parametrized tensor. Default: True.

class geotorch.manifold.EmbeddedManifold(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Base class for an embedded manifold. The class that implements the manifold should implement projection().

This class implements a simple manifold parametrized by some ambient space, projecting that point onto the manifold.

Parameters

  • dimensions (int) – Number of dimensions of the manifold as a tensor. For example, a matrix manifold would have 2 dimensions, while a vector would have 1. It should be a positive number

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

projection(X)[source]¶

Parametrizes the manifold in terms of a projection from the ambient space

Parameters

X (torch.Tensor) – A tensor in the ambient space

Returns

A tensor on the manifold

Return type

tensor (torch.Tensor)

class geotorch.manifold.Fibration(dimensions, size, total_space)[source]¶

Base class for a fibration for parametrizing a manifold \(M\) in terms of another manifold \(E\) through \(\pi \colon E \to M\). The class that implements this one should implement embedding() and fibration()

Note

This class is a bit abstract at first sight, so it might be best understand it through exmaples. The simplest non-trivial example of this construction is the parametrization of the Stiefel manifold \(\operatorname{St}(n,k)\) in terms of \(\operatorname{SO}(n)\) where \(\pi\) is taking the first \(k\) columns of the orthogonal matrix (see geotorch.Stiefel and geotorch.LowRank).

This class automatically implement the framework of dynamic trivializations describe in Trivializations for Gradient-Based Optimization on Manifolds - Lezcano-Casado, M. (2019) allowing to perform Riemannian gradient descent by calling after each SGD step to update_base().

For matrix manifolds, this class identifies \(\mathbb{R}^{k \times n}\) with \(\mathbb{R}^{n \times k}\) for \(k > n\) by transposing the matrix before and after applying the trivialization.

Parameters

  • dimensions (int) – Number of dimensions of the manifold as a tensor. For example, a matrix manifold would have 2 dimensions, while a vector would have 1. It should be a positive number

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to

  • total_space (geotorch.AbstractManifold) – The geotorch.Manifold, geotorch.Fibration of geotorch.ProductManifold that acts as a total space for the fibration

embedding(X, B)[source]¶

Embeds a vector \(X \in T_B M\) in the tangent space of \(M\) onto the tangent space of the total space \(T_{\pi^{-1}(B)}E\) via a local section of \(\pi\).

Parameters

  • X (torch.Tensor) – A tensor from the tangent space \(T_B M\)

  • B (torch.Tensor) – A point on the manifold \(M\) at whose tangent space we are trivializing

Returns

A tensor on a tangent space to the total

space at \(\pi^{-1}(B)\)

Return type

tensor (torch.Tensor)

fibration(X)[source]¶

Parametrizes the manifold in terms of the total space. This map should, when possible, be a submersion (surjective with full rank differential)

Parameters

X (torch.Tensor) – A point on the total space

Returns

A tensor on the manifold

Return type

tensor (torch.Tensor)

update_base(zero=True)[source]¶

Updates the base of total space

Parameters

zero (bool,Optional) – If True, this method will zero-out the parametrized tensor. Default: True.

class geotorch.manifold.ProductManifold(manifolds)[source]¶

Product manifold. It can be indexed like a regular Python list, but it cannot be modified

This class automatically implement the framework of dynamic trivializations describe in Trivializations for Gradient-Based Optimization on Manifolds - Lezcano-Casado, M. (2019) allowing to perform Riemannian gradient descent by calling after each SGD step to update_base().

Note

This manifold is mostly useful in combination with Fibration, to create quotients of product manifolds, such as LowRank

Parameters

manifolds (iterable) – an iterable of manifolds

class geotorch.manifold.AbstractManifold(dimensions, size)[source]¶

Base class for all the manifolds. This class implements some basic printing and creates some helper attributes for matrix manifolds such as self.n and self.k

Parameters

  • dimensions (int) – Number of dimensions of the manifold as a tensor. For example, a matrix manifold would have 2 dimensions, while a vector would have 1. It should be a positive number

  • size (torch.size) – Size of the tensor to be applied to
